title: Account Manager Job at International Flavors & Fragrances
content:
International Flavors & Fragrances is an industry leader in food, beverage, health, biosciences and sensorial experiences, where science and creativity meet to create essential solutions for a better world – from global icons to unexpected innovations and experiences. With the beauty of art and the precision of science, we are an international collection of thinkers who partner with customers to bring scents, tastes, experiences, ingredients and solutions for products the world craves. Together, we will do more good for people and planet.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Manager

Job Requisition ID: R6517
Job Location: Lagos (Remote)
Job type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	Responsible for driving sustainable profitable sales and market share growth by identifying the customer needs and opportunities, establishing solid customer relationship, leading, coordinating and reporting IFF activities and promoting relevant solutions aligned with corporate strategy. For a defined territory, category, coordinated or global account:
	Ensure financial targets are met and business performance is constantly monitored and reported; develop and maintain sustainable relationships with internal and external customers; prepare account plan and report relevant market information
	Collaborate with internal departments to explore innovations and new concepts related to customers’ products and on-going projects; monitor market development in terms of competitors, products, and trends
	Partner with operation team to ensure customer satisfaction in terms of service, quality, and supply.


Responsibilities


	Understand specific market and customer ecosystem including activities, strategies, brands, markets, consumers via different sources
	Develop multi-level cross-functional customer relationships with key customer decision makers/influencers
	Contribute/lead commercial negotiation(e.g., core listing, annual pricing, payment terms, rebates/cost savings agreements, supply contracts)
	Maximize potential advantage to IFF while delivering optimal solutions to customer (GP improvement, catalogue optimization, complexity reduction, etc.)
	Demonstrate IFF Culture Principles and live our values
	Manage and/or mentor junior team members/peers, and onboard and coach new team members
	Influencing stakeholders to align on shared objectives
	Ensure customer supply chain requirements, processes and KPIs are well communicated to IFF Operations to ensure we meet customer needs
	Understand customer regulatory requirements/changes and update data to GRA and input to project management system
	Acts as the main customer point of contact in all matters
	Lead projects through effective communication, and collaboration with key external and internal stakeholders(CI/Marketing/Creative Teams/formulation etc.)
	Ensure objectives are aligned to the business and personal development plans are in place
	Proactively solicit and give feedback to nurture high performing teams
	Demonstrate leadership courage by challenging the status quo and holding self and others accountable to always doing the right things
	Develop commercial strategy for allocated customer portfolio
	Build and execute account plans successfully
	Responsible for setting clear commercial targets (Sales/GP/New Win/Grow Market share) with the manager / Achieve new wins / grow market / market share aligned with account strategic plan
	Define and suggest the required account resources, investment, and relevant service model to support the account
	Effectively communicate the account plans with stakeholders including internal and external team members
	Review/update the progress of account plans versus KPI targets
	Ensure accurate monthly sales forecast to allow for effective operations planning and financial analysis
	Conduct retrospective reviews on projects wins and losses
	Review brief and ensure all objectives and parameters are clear
	Influence customer brief definition to IFF’s advantage
	Organize a formal commercial kick off with relevant stakeholders and finalize action plan, objectives & timelines with clear deliverables and key milestones and update Project Management System
	Liaise with Global/Regional/Category stakeholders on overall plan, strategy, and deliverables
	Evaluate and decide on final submissions with Scent Design Group and Creative teams
	Effectively promote the most appropriate IFF product solutions / portfolio aligned with the brief
	Generate proposal/price aligned with category margin guidelines or pricing officer
	Prepare presentation materials and staging submissions with stakeholders that maximizes IFF commercial advantage and resources
	Monitor and ensure cost-to-serve of projects adhere to guidelines
	Communicate project results and conduct retrospective reviews on projects wins and losses
	Update Project management system and issue adoption report in a timely manner
	Manage volumes/timing expectations and liaise with Operations to ensure supply chain readiness
	Defend and grow accounts whilst actively scouting for new customers, transforming leads into profitable business opportunities
	Accurately forecast and update sales forecast tool (SFT) to capture performance vs budget, business risk & opportunities, new wins
	Monitor & Provide Account sales performance (monthly / quarterly / annually) and provide strategic project updates to Manager
	Implement price increase in line with country/region strategy
	Lead internal and external teams to win projects


Requirements 


	Essential: Bachelor’s degree
	Approximately 3-5 years of experience in sales, sales service, product development, or marketing preferably fragrance, cosmetics, FMCG, flavors, chemical or ingredients industries
	Strong track record at a similar level with a passion to succeed in commercial Skills:
	Customer centric with B2B management experience
	Analytical with the ability to deal with financial concepts/processes(pricing/margin/forecasting)
	Strong interests in product development, consumers, and market understanding(Marketing/R&D/CI)
	Sound fragrance knowledge and olfactive skills or skin care and biochemistry knowledge, where applicable
	Creative and innovative thinking
	Project management with effective collaboration and orchestration skills
	Strong communication, presentation, storytelling, and negotiation skills
	Understanding of digital marketing and ecommerce environment
	Effective business English with a global mindset and ability to work with different cultures
	Digital savvy with an ability to leverage online resources
	Ability to gather and leverage competitive market intelligence, Training / Certifications


Preferred:


	Concentration in Business, Marketing, Chemistry, or Biology / Arts & Fashion Master's Degree.

title: Recruitment Officer Job at LibertyPay
content:
LibertyPay is a digital and payment solution institution that is led by Individuals with a passion to bridge the divide in every economic sphere. We seek to bring Financial Liberty and Freedom by filling the payments void within the business sectors in areas with Limited internet or reliable electricity ranging from Nano-Micro businesses to SMEs and personal finances.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Recruitment Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
Duration: 3-Month Contract

Job Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a skilled and motivated Recruitment Officer to join our HR team on a short-term basis.
	The ideal candidate will support the organization’s recruitment efforts by managing the full recruitment life cycle, from job posting to onboarding.
	This is a hands-on role requiring initiative, professionalism, and the ability to work under tight timelines.


Key Responsibilities


	Collaborate with department heads to identify hiring needs and job specifications.
	Prepare and publish job postings on internal and external platforms.
	Source candidates through online channels (LinkedIn, job boards, social media).
	Support pre-boarding and onboarding procedures for selected candidates.
	Review applications, shortlist candidates, and conduct initial screenings.
	Schedule interviews and manage communication between candidates and hiring teams.
	Maintain candidate records and reports in the applicant tracking system (ATS).
	Assist in the development and refinement of recruitment policies and tools.
	Ensure all hiring practices align with internal policies and relevant labor regulations.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	At least 1 - 3 years of experience in recruitment or HR operations.
	Strong familiarity with sourcing techniques, interview formats, and screening methods.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and recruitment software.
	Experience in contract-based or project-based hiring is a plus.


Key Skills:


	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to work with multiple stakeholders and manage competing priorities.
	High attention to detail and organizational ability.
	Sound judgment, discretion, and a professional demeanor.
	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: recruitment.libertyassured@gmail.com using "Recruitment Officer (3-Month Contract)->22605020-0c28-4d62-a53e-348f628d8a04" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Do not alter the prefilled email subject, for your application to be accepted!!

title: Officer, Buyer Job at DP World
content:
DP World - We exist to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally. With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 108,100 employees spanning 74 countries on six continents. We are pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future. We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Officer, Buyer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Function


	Responsible for identifying and procuring the spares and materials needed to maintain the constant operation of the transport unit of MDS Logistics Limited and management of the procurement of fuel to the dumps and all needed equipment and items by the transport unit.


Key Performance Areas


	Formulate implement procurement strategies aligned with organizational objectives, considering technical requirements, budgetary constraints, and supplier market dynamics.
	Conduct market research and analysis to identify potential suppliers, evaluate their capabilities, and select the most suitable vendors.
	Build and maintain relationships with key suppliers, ensuring effective communication, performance evaluation, and resolution of any issues or disputes.
	Facilitate negotiation of contracts, terms, and pricing with suppliers to obtain favourable conditions and achieve cost savings without compromising quality or timelines.
	Ensure proper monitoring of supplier performance, assess risks, and implement necessary corrective actions to maintain supplier compliance and maximize value.
	Supervise the end-to-end procurement process, including requisition processing, purchase order creation, supplier evaluation, and delivery coordination.
	Review technical specifications and collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure accurate and comprehensive procurement documentation.
	Implement effective cost control measures, such as contract management, demand forecasting, and inventory optimization.
	Conduct supplier evaluations, quality assessments, and inspections to ensure compliance with specifications, standards, and contractual requirements.
	Identify opportunities for cost savings and efficiency improvements within the technical procurement process.
	Analyse pricing trends, market dynamics, and supplier performance to negotiate competitive rates and achieve cost reductions.
	Ensure compliance with relevant procurement regulations, policies, and procedures.
	Assess and mitigate procurement-related risks, such as supplier reliability, quality control, and legal compliance.


Requirements


	Graduate Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering.
	Minimum 3-5 years of experience.
	Experience in tactical alignment to work within budgetary constraints
	Experience in having managed relationships at different levels.
